DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Blood Collection Social Role Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The role of the person that drew the blood.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._The action or activity assigned to or required or expected of a person or group.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:The action or activity assigned to or required or expected of a person or group.

Concepts.definition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
The action or activity assigned to or required or expected of a person or group.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts linked to Tissue Banking and Pathology activities

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person trained to collect blood for transfusion, analysis, or experimental testing.

Concepts.definition: A person trained to collect blood for transfusion, analysis, or experimental testing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A room in a health care facility equipped for the performance of surgical operations and procedures.: A person skilled in the performance of the technical or procedural aspects of a profession.

Concepts.definition: A room in a health care facility equipped for the performance of surgical operations and procedures.
A person skilled in the performance of the technical or procedural aspects of a profession.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A registered nurse who provides anesthetics to patients in collaboration with surgeons, anesthesiologists, dentists, podiatrists, and other qualified healthcare professionals. CRNAs practice with a high level of autonomy in most surgical practice settings. (AANA)

Concepts.definition: Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetist (CRNA) - a registered nurse who provides anesthetics to patients in collaboration with surgeons, anesthesiologists, dentists, podiatrists, and other qualified healthcare professionals.  CRNAs practice with a high level of autonomy in most surgical practice settings. (AANA)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A health professional trained to care for people who are ill or disabled.

Concepts.definition: A professional healthcare provider who has graduated from an accredited nursing program, has passed the state exam for licensure, and been registered or licensed to practice by a state authority.  Nurses are educationally prepared as functional (LPN/LVN) or professional (RN).

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Consent Or Study Site Research Coordinator

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Consent Or Study Site Research Coordinator
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Permission to do something.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: A person who handles the administrative responsibilities of a study on behalf of a study site, acts as a liaison between the study site and the study investigator and/or study sponsor, and reviews all data and records before a monitor's visit.

Concepts.definition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

A person who handles the administrative responsibilities of a study on behalf of a study site, acts as a liaison between the study site and the study investigator and/or study sponsor, and reviews all data and records before a monitor's visit.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A doctor who specializes in giving drugs or other agents to prevent or relieve pain during surgery or other procedures being done in the hospital.

Concepts.definition: A doctor who specializes in giving drugs or other agents to prevent or relieve pain during surgery or other procedures being done in the hospital.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
